intro: Xanthostemon oppositifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandblow, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are opposite and narrow, giving it a distinctive appearance. Xanthostemon oppositifolius is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
